channel.title: Eksplain - about programming
channel.description: Recent content on Eksplain - about programming

item.title: How I solve coding exercises
item.description: My current way so far is to: Translate the problem into mathematical terms, i.e. break it down in a way that it can be solved with some formula or repeating operations. I usually work out the problem on paper for a few inputs. Once I come up with a working formula, I evaluate its computational complexity as I have conceived it. Then I look for places where I can optimize it or go for less complexity.

item.title: Making sense of logarithms in computing and beyond
item.description: Every one for each other Consider the equation $$ a = b + c$$ In the above expression, the value of a is expressed in terms of b and c. We can also express the values of b and c in a similar manner. $$ b = a - c $$ $$ c = a - b $$ Now, consider the equation $$ p = q \times r$$ It can be expressed for q and r as

item.title: A Beginner friendly, practical introduction to algorithms and data structures
item.description: The friendly neighbor Let’s say you have downloaded an application and notice that it started to slow down your computer/mobile so much that you are not able to use the computer when the application is open. Obviously, you would delete the application, rate it poorly and would never recommend it to anyone. Whenever you write any code or build an application yourself, the application will most likely run alongside other apps.
